elements.content: Scheme 1 ZIF synthesis from MO/(OH)2 (M(II): Zn, Co).
elements.clean_text: Scheme 1  ZIF synthesis from MO/(OH)2 (M(II): Zn, Co).

elements.content:
Table 1 Summary of the reaction conditions and the obtained ZIFs indicating the reaction yield, representative structural data and the assigned CSD codea
M:Im:T Synthesis ratio Temp., °C Formula Yield (%) Netb T/Vc (nm−3) V d (%) CSDe
a A detailed description of the synthesis conditions, characterization and experimental data treatment is gathered in the ESI. b The network topology of the ZIF determined by the TOPOS program package.8 c Topological density. d Available free volume calculated by PLATON for the ZIF after the removal of the guest molecules9. e XRPD data of the prepared samples were used to scrutinise the CSD (Cambridge Structural Database, version May 2012) and assign the codes.10
Zn/Co-imidazolate
Zn:Im 1:2.1 100 [Zn4(Him)(Im)8]n 92.3 moc 4.45 1.9 KUMXEW
Zn:Im 1:2.1 160 [Zn(Im)2]n 87.2 zni 4.66 12.9 IMDZB02
Zn:Im:But 1:2.1:2.5 100 [Zn(Im)2]n 97.4 coi 4.75 7.6 IMDZB07
Co:Im:Py 1:2.1:2.5 100 {[Co(Im)2]·(Py)0.5}n 96.9 neb 3.82 32.3 EQOBUH
Zn:Im:Py 1:2.1:2.5 100 {[Zn(Im)2]·(Py)0.5}n 94.5 Isostructural to EQOBUH This work
Co:Im:4mPy 1:2.1:2.5 100 {[Co(Im)2]·(H2O)2.5·(4mPy)0.2}n 96.5 nog 3.50 40.3 This work
Zn:Im:4mPy 1:2.1:2.5 100 [Zn4(Him)(Im)8]n 91.3 moc 4.45 1.9 KUMXEW
Zn/Co-2-methylimidazolate
Co:mIm 1:2.1 160 {[Co(mIm)2]·(H2O)0.8}n 87.3 sod 2.46 50.0 GITTOT01
Zn:mIm 1:2.1 160 {[Zn(mIm)2]·(H2O)0.5}n 93.8 sod 2.45 50.7 TUDHUW
Fig. 1 A comparison of the XRPD patterns and SEM images of two samples of {[Co(Im)2]·(Py)0.5}n prepared through different thermal processes (upper: rapid heating rate, lower: low heating rate).
